greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Smallest cube containing exactly n 0's.
comment: a(n)^(1/3) = A048365(n) is the index of the first occurrence of n in A269250. -- For n = 3k, obviously a(n) = 10^n. The first terms for indices n = 3k+1 and n = 3k+2 equals 4096*10^3k resp. 140608*10^3k. Is there an index from where on this is no longer true? - _M. F. Hasler_, Feb 20 2016
xref: Cf. A036528 - A036536 for other digits 1 - 9.
results.author: _David W. Wilson_
ext: Extended to a(0) = 1 and three lines of data completed by _M. F. Hasler_, Feb 20 2016
